result.execSummary:
Mark Anthony Espinoza was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Mark Anthony Espinoza was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Anthony Espinoza

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: signed by EJL and Defendant this date. eif

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes,   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,   DF:  Mark Anthony Espinoza appeared from jail. Includes 15CF390 & 15CM475.  Defendant has a felony warrant out of DuPage County IL.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Defendant freely and knowingly waives extradition to IL in 15CF390.  ADA Niekses states he will do an Co. Ord. #52 with a fine of $114.50 on 15CM475. Defendant enters a NC plea to amended Count on 15CM475. Court accepts Defendant's plea and finds him Guilty with costs of $114.50, Defendant to pay today.
